com.ethercis.servicemanager.common.security

Interface I_MsgSecurityInterceptor

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    I_Session, I_Session

    public interface I_MsgSecurityInterceptor
    Interface declaring methods to intercept messages in the security layer to allow crypt/encrypt etc. messages before sending.

    If for example the server security service ciphers messages with rot13, we need to deciphers it on the client side with the same algorithm. This is done here.

    The reason is for clients to access xmlBlaster transparently from the authentication method

    For every service type you need, you need on instance of this class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      I_ContextHolder exportMessage(I_ContextHolder dataHolder)
      Encrypt, sign, seal an outgoing message.
      I_ContextHolder importMessage(I_ContextHolder dataHolder)
      Decrypt, check, unseal etc an incomming message.

    • Method Detail

      • importMessage

        I_ContextHolder importMessage(I_ContextHolder dataHolder)
                       throws ServiceManagerException
        Decrypt, check, unseal etc an incomming message.

        Use this to import (deciphers) the xmlKey or xmlQos

        Parameters:
        dataHolder - A container holding the MsgUnitRaw and some additional informations
        Returns:
        The original or modified message
        Throws:
        ServiceManagerException - Thrown i.e. if the message has been modified
        See Also:
        #exportMessage(CryptContextHolder)

      • exportMessage

        I_ContextHolder exportMessage(I_ContextHolder dataHolder)
                       throws ServiceManagerException
        Encrypt, sign, seal an outgoing message.

        Use this to export (encrypt) the xmlKey or xmlQos

        Parameters:
        dataHolder - A container holding the MsgUnitRaw and some additional informations
        Returns:
        The probably more secure string
        Throws:
        ServiceManagerException - Thrown if the message cannot be processed
        See Also:
        #importMessage(CryptContextHolder)
